attributes.description: A warrior who through thousands of years of fierce penance became a Brahman Saint; the son of Ku[ik.
A king of the Ikshváku line who sought a human victim for his sacrifice.
The middle son of Richíka who sold himself as a sacrificial victim and was saved by Vi[vámitra's hymns.
The King of Gods who repeatedly attempted to mar Vi[vámitra's penance using nymphs like Menaká and Rambhá.
The 'General Sire' or Creator who eventually granted Vi[vámitra the rank of Brahman Saint.
The daughter of Janak, found in a furrow of the earth; a 'prize of heroic worth'.
The King of Mithila and father of Sítá who possesses the wondrous bow of Rudra.
Also known as Ziva; the deity whose powerful bow is the central challenge for Sítá's suitors.
A sacred lake where Vi[vámitra performed his austerities and met Zunah[epha.
The city ruled by King Janak where the great bow is stored.
The highest spiritual rank sought by Vi[vámitra, requiring total control over rage and desire.

attributes.context: Vi[vámitra is Zunah[epha's uncle and savior from sacrifice.
Ambarísha bought Zunah[epha to serve as a victim in his sacrificial rite.
Indra acts as an antagonist, testing Vi[vámitra's resolve through temptation and distractions.
Brahmá confers the titles of 'Mighty Saint' and eventually 'Brahman Saint' upon him.
Janak is the adoptive father who found Sítá in the earth.
Rudra's bow was given to Janak's ancestor Devarát as a pledge.
Vi[vámitra brings Ráma and LakshmaG to Mithila to see the bow.
